anti_patterns.description: Flagging valid Python Protocol/ABC ellipsis syntax as placeholder content
anti_patterns.detection_pattern: Review flagging '...' in Python code blocks inside Protocol or ABC class definitions
anti_patterns.correction: Validate context before flagging ellipsis: check if preceded by def statement within 5 lines AND inside class inheriting from Protocol or ABC. Ellipsis is valid PEP 544 syntax for abstract method stubs.

anti_patterns.description: Parameter descriptions that only restate the parameter name
anti_patterns.correction: Describe what the parameter controls, valid values/ranges, defaults, and side effects
anti_patterns.example_good: | user_id | Unique identifier for the user account. Must be a valid UUID v4. |

anti_patterns.description: API documentation without error response examples
anti_patterns.detection_pattern: Endpoint documentation missing error codes section
anti_patterns.correction: Include at least common error responses (400, 401, 404, 500) with example bodies

anti_patterns.description: Long paragraphs without structure or formatting
anti_patterns.detection_pattern: Paragraph with >200 words without headers, lists, or code blocks
anti_patterns.correction: Break into smaller sections, use bullet points for lists, add code examples

anti_patterns.description: Code examples without explanation or context
anti_patterns.detection_pattern: Code block not preceded by explanatory text
anti_patterns.correction: Add a brief introduction explaining what the code does and when to use it

anti_patterns.description: Documentation that assumes too much prior knowledge
anti_patterns.detection_pattern: References to concepts not defined in document or prerequisites
anti_patterns.correction: Either define the concept, link to prerequisite docs, or list in Prerequisites section

anti_patterns.description: Screenshots that don't match current UI
anti_patterns.correction: Update screenshots when UI changes, include version/date in caption

anti_patterns.description: Documentation that references itself without adding value
anti_patterns.detection_pattern: Link that points to same document section
anti_patterns.correction: Remove circular references or replace with actual content

anti_patterns.description: Exposing internal implementation details to end users
anti_patterns.detection_pattern: References to internal class names, database schemas, or code paths
anti_patterns.correction: Focus on user-facing behavior and concepts, not internal implementation

anti_patterns.description: Excessive use of passive voice making instructions unclear
anti_patterns.detection_pattern: Multiple instances of 'is done', 'was created', 'should be'
anti_patterns.correction: Use active voice: 'Click the button' not 'The button should be clicked'

anti_patterns.description: Documentation that references wrong API version
anti_patterns.detection_pattern: Version numbers in code don't match header version
anti_patterns.correction: Ensure all version references are consistent and current
